column1:
LM001: Does your company have a Logging and Monitoring Policy or Standard?

If yes, please attach.
Artifact Required: Logging and Monitoring Policy

Design Elements:
1. Requirements for environment-wide security event logging practices including types of logs to maintain
2. Log review frequency is specified
3. Timeframes and location (e.g., syslog server) requirements for retention of logs
4. Requirements for review of logs
5. Procedure to escalate log monitoring anomalies or potential issues/incidents
column5:
Integral Development Corporation does not have a logging and monitoring policy or standard in place.



Assessor work steps: 
The assessor's comments were completed through review of the Third Party response and inquiry with Seeja Jiju, Program Manager on 07/23/2021.
column9:
Monitoring is inluded in the security policy.
"Integral has a proprietary system called Integral FX Cloudwatch, for monitoring, event management and load management. Automated alerts are generated for events. It is monitored daily by operations, engineering, and technical account management staff. It generates alerts based on anomalies"
column12: Updated to Design Gap. Design Element 3 is not captured in "LM001 - System Monitoring and Alerting Process.pdf [Stage 13]".

column1:
LM002: Has your company enabled logging for applications, platforms, network devices, databases and servers to track user activity?
Artifact Required: 
Example event log(s) / SIEM

Design Elements:
1. User identification
2. Type of event (e.g., logon/logoff)
3. Date and time
4. Success or failure
5. Origin of event
6. Identity or name of affected data, system component, or resource
7. Privileged account activity
8. User administration activities (adding/changing/revocation of User-IDs and changes to user access rights)
column4:
Sample Event Log(private)
Sample Admin Activity Log(private)
column5:
Integral Development Corporation does enable logging for applications, platforms, network devices, databases and servers to track user activity.



The following design elements are in place:
1. User identification
    Sample Event Log - Screenshot

2. Type of event (e.g., logon/logoff)
    Sample Event Log - Screenshot

3. Date and time
    Sample Event Log - Screenshot

4. Success or failure
    Sample Event Log - Screenshot

5. Origin of event
    Sample Event Log - Screenshot

6. Identity or name of affected data, system component, or resource
    Sample Event Log - Screenshot

7. Privileged account activity
    Sample Admin Activity Log - Screenshot

8. User administration activities (adding/changing/revocation of User-IDs and changes to user access rights)
    Sample Admin Activity Log - Screenshot


The assessor validated that Integral Logs capture all of the design elements. 

Assessor work steps: 
The assessor's comments were completed through review of the Third Party response, inquiry with Seeja Jiju, Program Manager on 07/23/2021 and observation of evidence.

Evidence referenced:
Sample Admin Activity Log - Documents were not retained but inspected and validated remotely.
Sample Event Log - Documents were not retained but inspected and validated remotely.

column1:
LM003: Does your company actively or periodically review user activity event logs?

If yes, please describe and document the frequency.
Artifact Required: 
Example evidence of completed periodic user account event log review
column5:
Integral Development Corporation does actively and/or periodically review user activity event logs.



The assessor observed an example real-time log review alert and validated that logs are reviewed in real-time as alerts are generated. 

Assessor work steps: 
The assessor's comments were completed through review of the Third Party response, inquiry with Seeja Jiju, Program Manager on 07/23/2021 and observation of evidence.

Evidence referenced:
Log Review - Documents were not retained but inspected and validated remotely.

column1:
LM004: Does your company maintain logs for a minimum of one year, in which three months of those logs are immediately available?

If yes, please describe record retention timeframe.
Artifact Required: Evidence that logs are being maintained according to log record retention timeframe requirements. (Screenshot showing 1 year of availability and 3 months of immediate availability.)
column5:
Integral Development Corporation does maintain logs for a minimum of one year, in which three months of those logs are immediately available.

The assessor validated through inquiry, that logs are maintained for at least 1 year of availability in archive and 3 months of immediate availability. Additionally, the assessor observed the SIEM dashboard and validated that logs go back to 6/1/2020.

Assessor work steps: 
The assessor's comments were completed through inquiry with Seeja Jiju, Program Manager on 07/23/2021 and inspection of evidence.

Evidence referenced:
SIEM Dashboard Log Retention - Documents were not retained but inspected and validated remotely.

column1:
LM005: Are your security audit logs copied to a separate and secure environment or centralized log management system in real time or near real time to reduce the risk of deletion or modification by system administrators (e.g., Syslog Server)?

If yes, please describe any tools used. If yes, please describe the tools used and whether tests are conducted after configuration changes.
Artifact Required:  
1. Evidence that logs are shipped to a centralized log server (e.g., syslog server)

2. A sample of a generated ticket or alert based on activity in a log
column5:
Integral Development Corporation does copy security audit logs to a separate and secure environment or centralized log management system in real time or near real time to reduce the risk of deletion or modification by system administrators (e.g., Syslog Server).

Integral security audit logs are copied within a secure environment in real-time. Logs are stored in read-only format to restrict system administrators from modifying or deleting logs. Logs are reviewed in real-time. 

The assessor observed a sample event log showing that is stored within a secure environment. Logs are reviewed in real-time by IT. As per SOC 2, CC5.1, systems are in place to log network security events and their information systems/IT group is notified in the event security thresholds are exceed. A screenshots of the system log notification system was reviewed and verified that systems were in place to log network security events and the Information Systems/IT Group was notified. 

Assessor work steps: 
The assessor's comments were completed through observation of evidence, inspection of evidence and inquiry with Seeja Jiju, Program Manager on 07/23/2021.

Evidence referenced:
Event Log - Documents were not retained but inspected and validated remotely.
Integral Development 2020 SOC 1 and ISAE 3402 Type 2 Report.pdf [Stage 5]

column1: LM006: Does your company set thresholds for normal activity on systems, networks, databases, and applications to better monitor and detect suspicious or abnormal activity and behaviors?
column5:
Integral Development Corporation does set thresholds for normal activity on systems, networks, databases, and applications to better monitor and detect suspicious or abnormal activity and behaviors.

Thresholds are held in the SIEM with alerts set when limits are reached.

Assessor work steps: 
The assessor's comments were completed through review of the Third Party response, inquiry with Seeja Jiju, Program Manager on 07/23/2021 and inspection of evidence.

Evidence referenced:
Integral Development 2020 SOC 1 and ISAE 3402 Type 2 Report.pdf [Stage 5]

column1:
LM007: Does your company actively monitor log file processing and storage capacity on production systems to confirm continued availability? 

If yes, please describe the alerting and remediation processes.
Artifact Required: 
A sample of a generated ticket or alert for when a specific production volume threshold is met.
column3: Monitoring process and dashboard screenshots are attached.
column5:
Integral Development Corporation does actively monitor log file processing and storage capacity on production systems to confirm continued availability.

Integral actively monitors log file processing and storage capacity on production systems. 

The assessor validated through inspecting log alerts and validated that automated alerting function is implemented for when a specific threshold is met. 

Assessor work steps: 
The assessor's comments were completed through review of the Third Party response, observation of evidence and inquiry with Seeja Jiju, Program Manager on 07/23/2021.

Evidence referenced:
Log Alert  - Documents were not retained but inspected and validated remotely.

column1:
LM008: Does your company have a control that allows you to review or detect unauthorized changes to files, systems, application binaries, and web pages on production systems (e.g., file integrity monitoring (FIM) software)?  

If yes, please describe the tools used for file integrity monitoring (FIM).
column5:
Integral Development Corporation does have a control that allows them to review or detect unauthorized changes to files, systems, application binaries, and/or web pages on production systems (e.g., file integrity monitoring (FIM) software) in place.

SolarWinds FIM is used. 

Assessor work steps: 
The assessor's comments were completed through review of the Third Party response and inquiry with Seeja Jiju, Program Manager on 07/23/2021.

column1: LM009: Has your company configured your systems or network devices with traffic capacity thresholds that automatically trigger an alarm or notification to support staff?
column5:
Integral Development Corporation has configured its systems or network devices with traffic capacity thresholds that automatically trigger an alarm or notification to support staff.





Assessor work steps: 
The assessor's comments were completed through review of the Third Party response.
